summary.para: Allows a client to specify which classes of objects in a Shell folder should be enumerated. When used with , specifies the class or classes of items that should be shown in the dialog box tree view and which class or classes should not.

param.name: psf
param.para: A pointer to the folder's interface.

param.name: phwnd
param.para: A pointer to the host's window handle.

param.name: pgrfFlags
param.para: One or more values that specify the classes of object to enumerate.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Specifies whether an individual item should be allowed through the filter and which should be blocked. When used with , specifies which items should be shown in the dialog box tree view and which should not. The determination to show or not show an item is up to the application.

param.name: psf
param.para: A pointer to the folder's interface.

param.name: pidlItem
param.para: The relative PIDL of the child item of pidlFolder in question.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if the item should be shown, S_FALSE if it should not be shown, or a standard error code if an error is encountered. If an error is encountered, the item is not shown.

remarks.para: The host calls this method for each item in the folder referred to by psf or pidlFolder.

summary.para: Exposed by a client to specify how to filter the enumeration of a Shell folder by a server application.

remarks.para: This interface is most often used with to filter the contents of the tree view displayed in a folder selection dialog box. To use IFolderFilter with SHBrowseForFolder, the flag must be set.

When your application calls , you become a client of the folder browser object. The folder browser object communicates with you by sending messages to a callback function, BrowseCallbackProc. The BFFM_IUNKNOWN message handled by that callback function contains a pointer to the folder browser's interface. To filter the display of a folder's contents, do the following:

item.description: Use the folder browser's method to request a pointer to the interface.
